main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a pale yellow light in the sky for about 5 minutes on November 22, 1966, in Fayetteville, N.C.
interesting points: The observer described the light as a shooting star that did not go out,The light drifted slowly to the southwest, possibly due to winds,Official explanation suggests the light could be parachute flares,There was no physical evidence of the sighting,The witness was a civilian copywriter for a local radio station with fair reliability.
sighted object: a pale yellow light in the sky
